title: How to Say Hello in Maori

steps.title: Say hello to one person, informally.
steps.content: Say hello to one person, informally. "Kia Ora" This is pronounced: Key or-rah. News readers on New Zealand TV stations usually say Kia Ora at the start of the news so listen to them, if you can, to perfect your pronunciation. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Say hello to one person, formally.
steps.content: Say hello to one person, formally. "Tena Koe" This is pronounced Te Na Ko E. In te reo MƒÅori, all the vowels are pronounced so Koe has two sounds, the co and the e. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Say hello to two people.
steps.content: Say hello to two people. "Tena korua" Sounds are, Te Na Kor Uh A. Don't forget to pronounce each vowel. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Say hello to three or more people.
steps.content: Say hello to three or more people. Use this greeting also for groups and big or small gatherings. ' "Tena koutou!" [5] X Research source 'Te Na Ko Uh Too Uh.
